definition: a time when people vote in order to choose someone for a political or official job
to gradually take away someone else's rights, or to take control of someone's time, work, etc; cover more and more of an area of land
to cut words, pictures, or patterns into the surface of metal, stone, etc
a piece of landed property, especially one of large extent with an elaborate house on it; (law) everything that a person owns when they die
to force someone to leave somewhere
to do or perform something, especially in a planned way; kill someone as a legal punishment
the total amount of money that a government or person spends
a situation in which something no longer exists
